section.p: The Control Machine must be connected to all remote machines on which components are to be installed. To configure the Control Machine, proceed as follows:

li.p: Log in to the Control Machine.
Open the Ansible configuration file with your favorite editor.
Specify the following SSH settings in the file:
li.codeblock:
[defaults] transport = ssh
[ssh_connection] ssh_args = -o ControlMaster=auto -o BatchMode=yes -o ForwardAgent=yes

li.p: Open the configuration file of the Control Machine with your favorite editor.
For detailed information on the configuration of the Control Machine, refer to the Ansible Inventory documentation.
Configure the required hosts in the configuration file. ships with a sample configuration file that you can use as a template:
The sample is located in the /opt/FJSVsvcmm/templates directory.
Copy the complete content of the sample file to your configuration file.
Replace all variables in the host definitions section:

ul.li: Offline Host for installing the offline resources required for the installation.
OpenStack Hosts for installing the OpenStack extensions on the Horizon host and the Keystone host.
<component> for installing the individual components on the cluster nodes.
Monasca Agent Nodes for Cluster for installing a Metrics Agent on the three nodes.
Monasca Log Agent Nodes for Cluster for installing a Log Agent on the three nodes.

li.p: Replace all host variables, for example {{ex_node_1_host}}, with the IP address of the remote machine on which you want to install the corresponding component.
li.note: supports and has been tested with IPv4. IPv6 and FQDN are not supported.
li.p: Replace all user variables, for example {{ssh_user_ex_node_1}} with the user name of the user who is to install component.
li.note: The user who is to install the component must have the privilege to execute sudo commands without password. Check your sudo configuration for this purpose.
li.p: Check that you have removed all curly brackets with your replacements.
To establish the connection between the Control Machine and the remote machines, generate the SSH key for Ansible.

note.p: If you have specified a passphrase for the SSH key, execute any install or uninstall command with the ssh-agent tool.
Make sure to stop the ssh-agent tool as soon as the installation or uninstallation is successful.

li.p: To copy the SSH key to the remote machines, execute the following command. Repeat the command for each machine.
Replace <user_name> by the user name to be used for accessing the remote machine, and replace <host_ip_address> by the IP address of the remote machine.
Example response for a successful connection to a remote machine:
li.codeblock:
/usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: INFO: attempting to log in with the new key(s), to filter out any that are already installed /usr/bin/ssh-copy-id: INFO: 1 key(s) remain to be installed -- if you are prompted now it is to install the new keys <user_name>@<host_ip_address>'s password:
Number of key(s) added: 1
Now try logging into the machine, with: "ssh '<user_name>@<host_ip_address>'" and check to make sure that only the key(s) you wanted were added.
